note.p: Birth: Parish of St Martin's-in-the-Fields, London, England (23 September 1783)
Death: His seat of Hatton, Middlesex (23 August 1870)
Education: St Paul's School; Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1806, Senior Wrangler and Smith's Prizeman), MA (1809)

Career: Fellow, Trinity College, Cambridge; called to the Bar at Middle Temple; went on the northern circuit and built up a large practice King's Council (1827); Attorney General (1834-1835, 1841-1844); Chief Baron of the Exchequer (1844-1866); created baronet on retirement (1866); died of old age
